ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Work with 'GitHub' 'gists' from 'R' (e.g.,  <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GitHub#Gist>,  <https://help.github.com/articles/about-gists/>). A 'gist' is simply one or more files with code/text/images/etc. This package allows the user to create new 'gists', update 'gists' with new files, rename files, delete files, get and delete 'gists', star and 'un-star' 'gists', fork 'gists', open a 'gist' in your default browser, get embed code for a 'gist', list 'gist' 'commits', and get rate limit information when 'authenticated'. Some requests require authentication and some do not. 'Gists' website:  <https://gist.github.com/>.

Work with 'GitHub' 'gists' from 'R' (e.g.,  <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GitHub#Gist>,  <https://help.github.com/articles/about-gists/>). A 'gist' is simply one or more files with code/text/images/etc. This package allows the user to create new 'gists', update 'gists' with new files, rename files, delete files, get and delete 'gists', star and 'un-star' 'gists', fork 'gists', open a 'gist' in your default browser, get embed code for a 'gist', list 'gist' 'commits', and get rate limit information when 'authenticated'. Some requests require authentication and some do not. 'Gists' website:  <https://gist.github.com/>.

name: r-gistr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.9.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-gistr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: gistr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/gistr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/gistr/gistr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 170ae025151ee688e7d31b9e49112086a8ddf4fef10155e9ee289ad7f28c8929

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-crul
    - r-dplyr
    - r-httr
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-knitr
    - r-magrittr
    - r-rmarkdown
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-crul
    - r-dplyr
    - r-httr
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-knitr
    - r-magrittr
    - r-rmarkdown

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('gistr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('gistr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ropensci/gistr
  license: MIT
  summary: "Work with 'GitHub' 'gists' from 'R' (e.g.,  <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GitHub#Gist>,  <https://help.github.com/articles/about-gists/>). A 'gist' is simply one or more files with code/text/images/etc. This package allows the user to create new 'gists', update 'gists' with new files, rename files, delete files,\
    \ get and delete 'gists', star and 'un-star' 'gists', fork 'gists', open a 'gist' in your default browser, get embed code for a 'gist', list 'gist' 'commits', and get rate limit information when 'authenticated'. Some requests require authentication and some do not. 'Gists' website:  <https://gist.github.com/>."
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
